div.pre: 1908 Calabria (anc. Bruttium), 1864 (183) Burial: c. 390 B.C. (K) Contents: 97 AR Taras: 17 st. (1 hippocamp; 4 oecist; 12 horsemen) Metapontum: 10 st. (4 incuse; 6 obv. De- meter) Thurium: 26 st. Caulonia: 13 st. (1 incuse; 12 double-relief) Croton: 19 st. (12 incuse; 7 double-relief, tripod) Pandosia: 1 st. (Hera facing/Pan seated) Terina: 10 st. Corinth: 1 st. Disposition: Boston 1 Pandosia (Brett 196) Sambon, Recherches, p. 35 Sambon believed that the absence of coins of Heracleia indicated a date of burial before 433 B.C., but Heracleia minted few staters before 400 B.C. The coin of Pandosia cannot be earlier than this
